title: Burgess Said To Be Sticking With Union
text:
Burgess Said To Be Sticking With Union 11:44, UK, Thursday 08 October 2015 Share by email Sam Burgess will stay in rugby union and will play in the 2019 World Cup for England as a blindside flanker, according to his club coach Mike Ford. 
Burgess' inclusion in the England World Cup squad - and then the starting XV- has been a major talking point in recent months and the former rugby league star is not included in the 23 for England's match against Uruguay this Saturday. 
He has played the majority of his Bath matches as a flanker, but England have used him as a battering ram centre. 
England crashed out of the World Cup after defeats to Wales and Australia, and there was speculation that Burgess might return to the 13-man code. 
But Bath coach Ford told The Times that Burgess would be extending his contract at The Rec by two years, which would take him to the 2019 World Cup. 
Ford said: "The last conversation I had with him, he was going to extend his contract with us and he wanted to go to the next World Cup. He is going to play for us for the next few years. He loves rugby union, he is settled in Bath and he knows he is a six [blindside flanker]. 
"He said to me 'I know I am a six'. He enjoys being a six, he enjoys the game better because he is more involved. Proving he is an international back-rower is the big challenge now for Sam." 
England coach Stuart Lancaster did not consider Burgess as an option in the back row because he was not a viable line-out jumper. 
But Ford said: "We've said 'Come back to Bath, carry on playing well'. We have an unbelievable run of fixtures coming up. We have Toulon, Leinster, Leicester, Northampton and Wasps twice. 
"If he can play six in those games against the best in Europe, I am sure England will have a look at him in that role. I am sure he'll break into the international squad as a six. I am hoping that he excels with us over the next few months and then if England consider him again, it'll only be in the back row. 
"We will no doubt show everyone he is a back row, not a centre." Promoted Stories
